metadata.name: File Download From Browser Process Via Inline URL
metadata.comment: Detects execution of a browser process with a URL argument pointing to a file with a potentially interesting extension. This can be abused to download arbitrary files or to hide from the user for example by launching the browser in a minimized state.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\brave.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\chrome.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\msedge.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\opera.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\vivaldi.exe'))) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('http')) AND (endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.7z')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.dat')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.dll')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.hta')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.ps1')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.psm1')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.txt')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.vbe')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.vbs')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.zip'))))

output.summary: Detects execution of a browser process with a URL argument pointing to a file with a potentially interesting extension. This can be abused to download arbitrary files or to hide from the user for example by launching the browser in a minimized state.
